column2: ggplot(aes(y = perf, x = familiarity, color = experiment_condition, group = experiment_condition)) +
theme(text = element_text(size=30, family = font_style), axis.text.y = element_text(size = 15, family = font_style),
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'experiment_condition', 'familiarity', 'prediction_type_simplified'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
